thread.title: Kanye West takes to Twitter to rant about in-app purchases in children's games
thread.title_full: Kanye West takes to Twitter to rant about in-app purchases in children's games

author: canberratimes.com.au
title: Kanye West takes to Twitter to rant about in-app purchases in children's games
text:
Kanye West says children's gaming apps should not allow in-app purchases. Photo: Matt Sayles 
Kanye West is reputedly worth about $US130 million, but that apparently does not stop him from worrying about a common problem for budget-conscious parents.
The  rapper and music producer has taken to Twitter to let off steam about apps for children that allow purchases of games.
West has a daughter, North West, with his wife, Kim Kardashian Photo: Craig Barritt 
If a game is made for a 2 year old, just allow them to have fun and give the parents a break for Christ sake.
— KANYE WEST (@kanyewest) October 10, 2015 Advertisement 
That makes no sense!!! We give the iPad to our child and every 5 minutes there's a new purchase!!!
— KANYE WEST (@kanyewest) October 10, 2015 "F--- any game company that puts in-app purchases on kids games!!!" he wrote to his 14 million-plus Twitter followers. "If a game is made for a 2 year old, just allow them to have fun and give the parents a break for Christ sake."
West has a daughter, North West, with his wife, Kim Kardashian, and the couple are expecting a baby boy in December.
In August, the rapper seemed to announce he would run for President in 2020 at the MTV Video Music Awards ceremony. Should he proceed with the campaign, this might be an issue voters can get behind.
